author: cnbc.com
title: Learn about Turf Removal and Water Efficient Landscaping at Mesa Water’s Free Workshop, Saturday March 10th
text:
Annual Springtime Landscape Workshop Takes Place at Mesa Water’s Headquarters, 8:30 a.m.-12:00 p.m.
Mesa Water District:
WHO:
The Mesa Water District (Mesa Water®) Board of Directors invites customers and community members to learn about drought-tolerant landscaping at Mesa Water’s annual springtime landscape workshop , taught by the district’s Water Use Efficiency Analyst. The workshop is FREE and open to the public and press.
WHAT:
Participants will learn more about using water wisely outdoors, including:
■ Turf Removal Methods
■ Garden Design & Maintenance
■ California Friendly Plants
■ Water/Money-Saving Rebate Programs
■ Efficient Sprinkler Systems, Drip Irrigation, and Smart Sprinkler Timers WHERE:
Mesa Water District Boardroom
1965 Placentia Avenue, Costa Mesa 92627 WHEN:
Saturday, March 10, 2018 - 8:30 a.m. to 12:00 p.m.
HOW:
To attend, please RSVP online at MesaWater.org/LandscapeWorkshop , or email conservation@MesaWater.org , or call 949.631.1201. Space is limited…sign up now! (RSVPs accepted first-come, first-served.)
WHY:
It’s always smart to be water wise! As part of its strategic plan goal to provide outstanding customer service, Mesa Water® encourages water use efficiency throughout our service area by offering water awareness and education programs that inform residents and businesses about ways to save water, which also saves money and the environment. For more water-saving information, visit MesaWater.org/save-water .
About Mesa Water
Founded on January 1, 1960, and governed by a publicly-elected, five-member Board of Directors , Mesa Water is an independent special district that provides water service to 110,000 residents in an 18-square-mile service area that includes most of Costa Mesa, a portion of Newport Beach, and John Wayne Airport. Mesa Water provides 100 percent local reliable groundwater to its customers due to the Mesa Water Reliability Facility . Visit MesaWater.org , follow @MesaWater on Facebook , Twitter , or Instagram , email info@MesaWater.org , or call 949.631.1200 to learn more.
